newsitem.title: FRANCE: SCAC Air optimistic on 1997 outlook.
newsitem.headline: SCAC Air optimistic on 1997 outlook.

text.p: French air forwarding agents, SCAC said it expected to at least match its 1996 operating performance in 1997.

"Last year, our net turnover was up eight to nine percent on 1995 levels to around roughly 320 million francs ($55 million) with volume of traffic up by a similar amount," SCAC Air's managing director, Herbert De St Simon, told Reuters.
The past six months or so had been marked by buoyant activity and the signature of contracts with new customers, De St Simon said.

"Our established export markets - the U.S., the Far East, West Africa and French overseas territories - are generating a good level of demand and the outlook for the remainder of 1997 is positive." - Reuters Air Cargo Service Tel+44 171 542 7706 Fax+5017 - www.racs.com ($ = 5.823 French Francs)
